title: From a daughter to a laughter
text:
That hutch
we made blueprints of
for rabbits 
we never bought.

Or the driving lessons 
in which we never stopped
screaming but never gave up on.

Sometimes I feel
as if 
I am another
thing you just canâ€™t give up 
giving up on
as if
we are simultaneously both too much
and not enough for the other.

On the one hand
I am not
a boy, a man or a son. 
You, on the other, never can quite 
remember my birthday.

Yet, sometimes still it comes back to us
sails in on a fresh sea
like waking up in another country. 
We dance on the roof
and sing the songs that we have always 
known the tune to.
